required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Chlorogenic Acid on Patients With Impaired Glucose Tolerance
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of the Administration of Chlorogenic Acid on Glucemic Control, Insulin Secretion and Insulin Sensitivity in Patients With Impaired Glucose Tolerance

brief_summary.textblock: Chlorogenic acid has demonstrated promising effects in the treatment of glycemic control, obesity, dyslipidemia, insulin secretion, among others. The above mentioned findings show that Chlorogenic acid has an excellent potential for the control of glucose as well as insulin secretion and insulin sensitivity.

detailed_description.textblock:
A randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled clinical trial was carried out in 30 patients with a diagnosis of impaired glucose tolerance in accordance with the American Diabetes Association criteria. The patients received 400 mg capsules of Chlorogenic acid or placebo, three times daily 1/ 2 hour before meals for 90 days. Before and after intervention the investigators evaluated: 2 hours plasma glucose, glycated hemoglobin (A1C), triglycerides, high-density lipoprotein, fasting glucose and blood pressure body weight, body mass index, waist circumference, total cholesterol, low-density lipoprotein, very-low-density lipoprotein, creatinine, aspartate transaminase and alanine transaminase.
Were calculated: Areas under the curve of glucose and insulin were calculated with de Trapezoidal formula. Total insulin secretion was evaluated with the Insulinogenic index and the insulin sensitivity was estimated using the Matsuda index.

primary_outcome.description: Reflect the fasting glucose level after a 10- to 12-h overnight fast.
Subjects underwent a 2-h oral glucose tolerance test (2-h OGTT) by consuming 75-g of a dextrose load, and one sample was obtained 120 min after glucose administration.
Shows what a person's average blood glucose level was for the 2 to 3 months before the test high-performance.
After intervention. Total insulin secretion was calculated with the Insulinogenic index (Δ ABC insulin / Δ ABC glucose).

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve of Glucose
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the curve of glucose was obtained using the trapezoidal integration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve of Insulin
secondary_outcome.description: Before and after intervention area under the curve of insulin
The weight was measured at baseline, week 4, week 8 and week 12 with a bioimpedance balance and the entered values reflect the weight at week 12
The Body Mass index was calculated at baseline and at week 12 with the Quetelet index and the entered values reflect the body mass index at week 12
Waist circumference was evaluated at baseline and at week 12 with a flexible tape and the entered values reflects the waist circumference measure at week 12
The Systolic Blood Pressure was evaluated at baseline and week 12 with a digital sphygmomanometer and the entered values reflect the blood pressure at week 12
The Diastolic blood plessure was evaluated at baseline and week 12 with a digital sphygmomanometer and the entered values reflect the blood pressure at week 12
The triglycerides were evaluated at baseline and week 12 with enzymatic-colorimetric techniques and the entered values reflect the triglycerides level at week 12
The total cholesterol was estimated by standardized techniques at baseline and week 12 and the entered values reflect the total cholesterol level at week 12
The HDL-C levels were evaluated at baseline and week 12 with enzymatic/colorimetric techniques and the entered values reflect the HDL-C level at week 12
The LDL-C levels were measured at baseline and at week 12 with standardized techniques and the entered values reflect the LDL-C levels at week 12
The VLDL levels were measured at baseline and at week 12 with standardized techniques and the entered values reflect the c-LDL levels at week 12
Before and after intervention by spectrophotometry
Before and after intervention by spectrophotometry
The creatinine levels were measured at baseline and at week 12 with standardized techniques and the entered values reflect the uric acid levels at week 12
The uric acid levels were measured at baseline and at week 12 with standardized techniques and the entered values reflect the creatinina levels at week 12.

arm_group.description: 1200 mg dose per day, three capsules of 400 mg, times daily 1/ 2 hour before meals during 90 days.
1200 mg dose per day, three capsules of 400 mg, times daily 1/ 2 hour before meals during 90 days.

intervention.description: Placebo: 1200 mg per day for three months
Chologenic acid: 1200 mg per day for three months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BMI: 30.0-34.99 kg / m2.
- Diagnosis of IGT (OGTT Values between 140mg / dl and 199mg / dl.
- Written informed consent.
- Body weight stable over the last 3 months.
- Women in follicular phase of the menstrual cycle (days 3 to 8 of the cycle) at the time of laboratory tests.
- Women who are not contemplated get pregnant within the next 6 months.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women pregnant or breastfeeding.
- Physical or mental disability that makes it impossible to perform the intervention.
- Diagnosis of Hypertension or heart failure.
- Smokers.
- Untreated thyroid disease.
- Consumption of oral agents or other medications or supplements with proven properties that modify the behavior of glucose and lipids (oral hypoglycemic agents, insulin, lipid-lowering).
- Diagnosis of liver disease or elevation twice of the upper normal value of liver enzymes.
- Diagnosis of renal disease or creatinine > 1.5 mg / dl.
- Diagnosis of Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (T2DM) Fasting glucose ≥ 126 mg / dL and/or OGTT ≥ 200 mg / dL and/or A1C ≥ 6.5%.
- Total Cholesterol ≥ 280 mg/dL.
- Triglycerids ≥ 300 mg/dL.
- Known allergy to calcined magnesia or Chorogenic acid.

facility.name: Institute of Experimental and Clinical Therapeutics (INTEC), CUCS, University of Guadalajara

group.title: Placebo
group.description: 1200 mg dose per day, three capsules of 400 mg, times daily 1/ 2 hour before meals during 90 days. Placebo: Placebo: 1200 mg per day for three months

group.title: Chlorogenic Acid

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Body weight
measure.description: Body weight was evaluated through a bioimpedance digital scale and results are reported in kg with a decimal.

measure.title: Waist circumference
measure.description: Waist circumference was measured with a flexible tape in them id point between the lowest rib and the iliac crest and is expressed in centimeters.

measure.title: Systolic blood pressure
measure.description: Blood pressure was evaluated with a digital sphygmomanometer with the subject sited down on a chair after a resting period of 5 minutes on three occasions. The mean of the three measures was considered as the value of diastolic blood pressure (DBP). The value was expressed on mmHg

measure.title: Diastolic blood pressure
measure.description: Blood pressure was evaluated with a digital sphygmomanometer with the subject sited down on a chair after a resting period of 5 minutes on three occasions. The mean of the three measures was considered as the value of diastolic blood pressure (DBP). The value was expressed on mmHg.

measure.title: Fasting plasma glucose
measure.description: The blood sample for determining of fasting plasma glucose (FPG), was taken after an overnight fast and was evaluated by spectrophotometry method. The value was expressed on mmol/L.

measure.title: 2-hour plasma glucose
measure.description: The blood sample for determining of 2-hour plasma glcuose (2-h PG), was taken two hours after the ingestion of the drink with 75 g dextrose and was evaluated by spectrophotometry method. The value was expressed on mmol/L.

measure.title: Triglycerides
measure.description: The blood sample for determining of triglycerides (TG), was taken after an overnight fast and was evaluated by spectrophotometry method. The value was expressed on mmol/L.

measure.title: Total cholesterol
measure.description: The blood sample for determining of total cholesterol (TC) , was taken after an overnight fast and was evaluated by spectrophotometry method. The value was expressed on mmol/L.

measure.title: High-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C)
measure.description: The blood sample for determining of HDL-C, was taken after an overnight fast and was evaluated by colorimetric method. The value was expressed on mmol/L.

measure.title: Low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C)
measure.description: The blood sample for determining of LDL-C, was taken after an overnight fast and was calculated by Friedewald formula. The value was expressed on mmol/L.

measure.title: Area under the curve of glucose (AUCG)
measure.description: Area under the curve of glucose was obtained using the trapezoidal integration.

measure.title: Area under the curve of insulin (AUCI)
measure.description: Area under the curve of insulin was obtained using the trapezoidal integration.

measure.title: Total insulin secretion
measure.description: Total insulin secretion was calculated with the Insulinogenic index (Δ ABC insulin / Δ ABC glucose).

measure.title: First phase of insulin secretion
measure.description: Calculated by Stumvoll index [1283 + 1.829 · insulin 30 min (pmol/L) -138.7 · glucose 30 min (mmol/L) + 3.772 · insulin 0 min (pmol/L)]

measure.title: Insulin sensitivity
measure.description: Insulin sensitivity was calculated with Matsuda index [10,000 / √glucose 0' x insulin 0') (mean glucose oral glucose tolerance test (OGTT) x mean insulin OGTT)]

outcome.title: Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG)
outcome.description: Reflect the fasting glucose level after a 10- to 12-h overnight fast.
outcome.population: 3 and 1 subjects dropout in the placebo and chlorogenic acid group respectively.

outcome.title: Creatinine
outcome.description: The creatinine levels were measured at baseline and at week 12 with standardized techniques and the entered values reflect the uric acid levels at week 12
